titleStmt.title: John McCoy et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9319

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To the honerable Beriah Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky petition --

the undersigned petitioners respectfully state, to your Honour, that, Mr James Lackey formerly a citizen of Lexington, is now undergoing confinement and labour in the Penetentiary of Kentucky; they state farther that Said Lackey is very Young, and of pardoned, and restored to his friends, would make a usefull citizen -- they think him a fit and proper subject, for executive clemency, they therefore earnestly and respectfully ask your Honour to grant, to said Lackey, a pardon and Your petitioners as in duty bound will ever pray your Honours health and hapiness --

B F Graves
Jno C Hansbro
Frank Waters
Frank.G. Flanagan
E. D. Burke
John C. Breckinridge
Geo W Hunt
W. L Thwaits
R J Breckinridge Jr
John. M. Babb
Augustus Babb.
Dennis, Mulligan
Geo C Morris
Thomas G, Randall
Jno H Morgan
John B Pryor Jr
Thos Bradley
Chas Curry
C. C. Morgan
Joseph G Boswell
E R Hoagland
Geo A Shely
John W Bittenger
J. M. Graves
